found_issues.title: [MooreToCore] Crash with sqrt/floor
found_issues.reason: Same dyn_cast assertion failure in MooreToCore pass. Same error signature and conversion-related failure, but triggers via ConversionOp rather than module port types. Both involve failed type conversions returning null/unsupported types.

found_issues.title: [FIRRTL] Integer Property folders assert in getAPSInt
found_issues.crash_signature: assertion in getAPSInt about signless integers
found_issues.reason: Different dialect (FIRRTL vs Moore/HW). Different assertion and type system. Not similar enough.

found_issues.title: [FIRRTL] Crash with fstring type on port
found_issues.reason: Same dyn_cast assertion pattern on non-existent values during type conversion. Involves port lowering but in FIRRTL dialect. Similar type validation failure pattern.

found_issues.title: [MooreToCore] VariableOp lowered failed
found_issues.crash_signature: stack dump during MooreToCore conversion with InOutType
found_issues.reason: Same MooreToCore pass. Involves InOutType casting failures. Different trigger (struct vs union port type) but same fundamental issue: InOutType casting during port/type conversion.

analysis_summary.notes: Issue #8930 (sqrt/floor) has same exact assertion signature but different triggering construct. Issue #7535 (VariableOp) is likely a duplicate - same MooreToCore pass, same InOutType issue, different type construct. No exact duplicates found, but strong pattern correlation suggests this is a class of related type conversion failures in MooreToCore.
